does mean that we will continue to be

we will never and we can never be

and in the spirit of peace we call on

the tragedy of war is not just that

extra
122 million people across the world

it would be all too easy and all to
understandable
to fall into despondency to think

that we can make a difference that if a

annegling sense of insecurity post

they feel that the world is a less

I understand where those concerns are

is why I am into politics
it is why I am adamant that every Global

that we can show that by working

Solutions nationally that way
we can address what pessimists call the

we must be realistic
there is no magic wand
I am also realistic about what any
individual Nation can do and I am also

a small nation can do but if we all play
our part we can all make a difference in
short
we are stronger together
no one can feel secure about their

the biggest threat to our planet is

and climate change isn't some sort of

current pledges
and the current targets are not

the reach Malta wholeheartedly commands
the secretary-general's initiative to

Multan is a proud Maritime Nation the
sea plays a profound part in malta's
National Life and has a special place in
the hearts of the Maltese people
rising sea levels are a severe threat to
the security the livelihood and indeed
the very existence of Island countries
like ours securing the future of our
seas and oceans is an urgent imperative
of the government of Malta which is why
we have made climate and oceans the
number one priority during our term on
the United Nations security Council
and to give the debate new momentum we
made the high level meeting on the
implications of rising sea levels for
peace and security the signature event
of our presidency of the security
Council last February and we
enthusiastically extend our support for
the newly created Coalition on
addressing sea level rise and
existential threats
it is not just the direct consequences

freshwater shortages displacement of
people and food insecurity all risk

generating new conflicts and
exacerbating existing ones
rising sea levels also threaten the very
territorial Integrity of States as a

consequent danger of disputes
and conflict
so I wish to reiterate in the strongest
of terms as I already did at cop 27 that
no Coastal State should lose any of its

due to rising sea levels
as the United Nations we must preserve
the sovereignty of coastal States no
matter what the ravages of the sea
as island nations
we turn to the world but we don't turn

between small island countries is a key

we turn into practical support like the
majority of Nations and the EU and the

have experienced many of the same
challenges which are currently being
faced by developing countries that's why
we have made raising awareness of the

supporting sustainable development for

Cornerstone of our foreign policy to do

we share best practice and help build

protecting

those
who
state that securing the planet can only

environmental security can only be

Security only if you feel secure about

Protection

prospect
of a new era of protectionism
protectionism grows unchecked it could

as vested interests have given way to
Innovation they have seized the new
opportunities
and like many young economies Malta has

what the world economy

workers I understand
and also appreciate how some people feel

the pandemic showed the need to think

often and open trading should be fair
